episode_event_academy_winter/4001_1001_0: You wanna get better at sketching?

Yes! I started so I could observe
Pokémon better.

But lately, I’ve found drawing itself to
be fun!

So now I’ve become a bit more critical
of my work.
I can introduce you to someone!
episode_event_academy_winter/4002_1001_0:
My name is Hassel. I teach art classes
at an academy in Paldea.

I also teach art here at Pasio
Academy!

I heard from Rika you’re trying to get
better at sketching.

Yes! Would you mind giving me some
lessons?

Today, I’ve invited a special guest to
my class!
episode_event_academy_winter/4002_1001_1:
I have heard all about you
adolescents!
episode_event_academy_winter/6801_1001_0:
Knowledge and experience lead to
growth! The same goes for art. 
You must go out and learn!

You’ll have our support until the day
your talents bloom!

Thank you! I’ll be sure to keep
growing, just like a grass Pokémon!
episode_event_academy_winter/4003_1101_0:
After the appearance of the
mysterious man, Hassel’s art
lesson began.
episode_event_academy_winter/4003_1001_0: Allow me to introduce today’s guest.

I am an artist specializing in
Grass-type Pokémon. I am also
a Gym Leader in Paldea.

He’s created a few famous pieces,
such as the Surrendering Sunflora.

If you have any questions for him,
don’t hold back!

It’s nice to have you here teaching
us, Mr. Brassius!

Hmm... I am no teacher, so no need
for such esteem.

Teaching is a responsibility and
burden I am unsuited for!
episode_event_academy_winter/4003_1001_1:
I am here because my mentor in life,
dear Hass, asked me to be!

I am only a guest—please do not
misunderstand.
Brassie and I go way back.

But enough about the past.
Shall we begin?

First of all, it’s important to take an
interest in art—and enjoy it!

At the end of this lesson, I’d like
all of you to show me your art!

I look forward to seeing what your
eye for beauty produces.

All right! I’ve gotta draw something
I can be proud of!
episode_event_academy_winter/4003_1001_2: It’s about time to wrap up!
OK, everyone. What did you draw?
It’s time to present our drawings!

It may be a little awkward at first,
but it’s the fastest way to improve!
episode_event_academy_winter/4003_1001_3:
Knowing someone will see your work
can help you better your skills.

But...I didn’t have enough time,
and it’s not even complete...
episode_event_academy_winter/4004_1001_0:
Kris! Just because a work of art is
incomplete doesn’t mean you can’t
display it!

I understand the pain and the
struggle—of being unhappy with your
work but having to show it to others!
But your time this lesson was limited!

Sometimes speed is critical! If you’re
unable to finish in a certain time,
that’s simply your limit as an artist.
Why do you hang your head?
episode_event_academy_winter/4004_1001_1:
Today’s deadline was for this
lesson only!

It is the artist who decides whether
their work is complete!

Some pieces are done in a matter of
seconds!

But others may never be—even if the
artist spends their whole life on it!

Thus, if you feel your art is
incomplete...

then keep going! Spend all the time
you need until YOU say it’s complete!

That said, you set your expectations
far too high!

You love Pokémon so much, your
vision surpasses your ability!
episode_event_academy_winter/4004_1001_2:
So keep learning! And hone your eye
for beauty!

That is why schools and teachers
exist!

You can come to me about art
anytime—not just during class.

Dear Brassie! You’ve given my
students such a wonderful lesson...
episode_event_academy_winter/4004_1001_3:
You knew from the beginning,
didn’t you, Hass.

You realized Kris was in a slump,
just like I once was.

Yes, but I knew you’d be a good
influence, Brassie.

I truly believe that teaching,
my chosen profession, is what
I was born to do.

Taking on the responsibility for such
young, budding lives... It is still a
weight I could not bear.

If it’s a request from you, Hass,
I suppose I can’t decline.
episode_event_academy_winter/4005_1001_0:
Avant-garde! The ink you’ve used
gives your work depth!

Thank you! I guess handwriting all those
Pokédex entries finally paid off!

This painting roars like a dragon!
Your style is dynamic!

I can tell you have a passion for
Pokémon!

Hehehe! I’m glad my love of dragon
Pokémon comes through!

I see... Everyone has their own way of
expressing themselves.
Kris! How go your art studies?

Well, I’ve been challenging myself to
draw all sorts of things.
episode_event_academy_winter/4005_1001_1:
And I’m still adding to that sketch
I was working on before!

It’s getting closer and closer to what
I’d imagined!

That said, your expression is stiff!
Try breaking out of your shell!

(Young sprouts truly do grow with
astounding speed, yes...)
